page.title: 01OTTERY ST. MARY
page.content: Ottery St Mary is a small country town in East Devon twinned with Pont L'Eveque a town in Normandy, France. Ottery lies in the valley of the river Otter , 12 miles east of Exeter and 6 miles from the coastal resort of Sidmouth. It is one of the oldest and most{historic}towns in Devon. The bounds of the manor and parish were fixed by Edward the Confessor in 1061 and have remained virtually unchanged to this day. The town is mentioned in the{Doomsday Book 1086 as "OTREI".}The earliest reference to what is now the parish church is 1257. The church was enlarged to a collegiate church, modelled on Exeter Cathedral in 1342.In 1535 Henry V111 founded the Kings School, which today is the Comprehensive School for the area. At the time of the Great Civil War 1642
